meanings.definition: To make a series of slight cracking noises.
meanings.sent1: I heard the fire crackle in the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The leaves crackle under my feet as I walk through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn started to crackle in the microwave, making me hungry.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air seemed to crackle like electricity.
meanings.sent5: The campfire crackled and popped, creating a cozy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A series of slight cracking noises.
meanings.sent1: The crackle of the fire was soothing on a cold night.
meanings.sent2: The snap, crackle, and pop of the cereal made a cheerful breakfast sound.
meanings.sent3: The crackle of the old vinyl record added charm to the music.
meanings.sent4: The crackle of the campfire was the soundtrack to our camping trip.
meanings.sent5: The crackle of the fireworks filled the night sky with excitement.

meanings.definition: A network of fine cracks on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The old painting showed signs of crackle on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The crackle on the vase gave it a vintage look.
meanings.sent3: The crackle on the mirror made it look like a piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The crackle on the wall hinted at its age and history.
meanings.sent5: The crackle on the pavement made it slippery after the rain.
